page.title: 11 FRIDAY MARKET
page.content: In 1202 King John gave a charter granting a fair at Long Sutton each Friday. 50 years later in 1252, Henry III gave a charter, this time granting a market at Long Sutton each Thursday. The market is on Thursday when Friday is a Bank Holiday. Later, on Friday, September 26th, 1823 a free market was proclaimed in the Market Place. 10,000 people gathered to watch the opening. On Friday, 28th June, 1985 a survey carried out, noted these stalls. 2 Plant Stalls 1 Bike Stall 1 Jewelery Stall 1 D.I.Y. Stall 7 Clothes Stalls 1 Fishmongers 1 Underwear Stall 2 Shoe Stalls 1 Pet Suppliers 1 Bedding Stall 1 Baker's Stall 2 Fruit+Veg Stalls 1 Haberdashers 3 Sweet Stalls At 1 p.m. a hand bell signals the start of the weekly auction.
